section.title: Window manager
section.label: The window manager is a program which puts title bars and frames on windows. It allows you to move windows around, resize them, close them and so on.

section.title: Translation
section.label: Note that you must save your choices, logout and log back in again before the new settings will take full effect.

section.title: Display
section.label: This setting affects all Gtk+-2 applications, but many applications will ignore it.
section.font: The font used by Gtk+ applications

section.title: Mouse
section.slider: Time allowed between the two clicks that make up a double click. Make this bigger if you have trouble double-clicking fast enough; set it smaller if two single-clicks sometimes get treated as a double click.
Controls how fast you have to move the pointer before the acceleration (below) kicks in.
When the pointer is moved quickly more than the threshold number of pixels, its speed is multiplied by this number.

section.title: Keyboard
section.slider: Speed at which the text entry cursor flashes (if flashing is enabled).

toggle.name: Gtk/CanChangeAccels
toggle.label: Allow keybindings to be changed from menus

section.toggle: When this is on, you can set up a short-cut for a menu item by holding to pointer over the menu item and pressing the key. If off, short-cuts cannot be changed.

section.title: Messages
section.label: All programs have a 'standard error stream' which they can write text messages to. ROX-Session creates such a connection between itself and every program it starts. It displays all the messages it collects this way briefly on screen.

frame.label: On-screen message log
frame.numentry: Number of seconds to display each message for
